I like that Riot are working on modernizing the UI unlike competing games, but there's still too much bulk around the screen: the minimap has unnecessary things attached to it, which scale with the minimap size, not with the UI slider, and the center panel also has a lot of blank space between things. Don't even get me started on the store; it's so unnecessarily FAT.

When I first saw the concepts, I commented saying I think that having a champ icon is really old-fashioned. Honestly, if you don't know what champ you're playing, you should just alt-f4. Requiring it on the HUD to jump to your champ, implying you don't use the bound key to do so, is simply announcing that you're using inferior methods.

When scaling down the UI, the character stats icons are almost unreadable. This won't be a problem once we learn what's where and can just glance at it, but why was the panel completely replaced by this stupid little pop-out thing. I just think it feels like it was tacked on as an afterthought.

I could go on and detail every little thing that I think could be improved but most of that would be fixed if they just made the entire UI modular, allowing players to drag, drop and resize things on the HUD - They obviously already have the basics of this implemented, as you can do all that to the chat. I don't know why this update wasn't held off until we could see something like that.



...But seriously, wtf with the store page?

I do like the new UI, although the positioning of the team pictures above the minimap, making them smaller is something I'm not sure if I like or not. I'm leaning towards not.

Also, I noticed in spectator games, although it's possible to rearrange the summoner pictures in the item list, it's not possible to do it with the side icons. It might seem trivial, but that might be something to do, so you can arrange lanes there as well.

Also maybe, considering the amount of customization that is possible in the display of the TAB screen, perhaps an extra few seconds of forced inactivity at the start could be useful, so that you can still rush out and get vision where you want it, or protect against invades whilst still being able to arrange the TAB screen safely.

Thank you for listening.

Cant say i like this new Hud much. Everything has been squashed into one little corner.  Having so many different icons and counters ect all in the one space makes it difficult to distinguish at a quick glance. The team-mate icons are tiny, the dragon ect timers now only show up when you press tab, what was wrong with them being permanently at the top of the screen? All your attention is focused primarily on the center of the screen during game-play, all the outer edges top and left are now just wasted space since you have removed everything from them.  But my biggest issue is the character stats screen on " C " . Its been reduced so much that its utterly worthless. You have to hover the mouse over each little icon to actually have it show the name of what stat it is , thats far more fiddly then just quickly bringing up the larger scale menu to check your stats.
